bibl.title: James A. Balch v. J.W. Waughop. Motion
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: In the matter of James A. Balch on Habeas Corpus Proceedings
Now comes the said petitioner by his atty. and moves the court to grants and asks the return to the writ of Habeas Corpus heretofore made by J.W. Waughhop among other for the following reasons.
1. The facts stated in said return do not justify the petition of said Balch in said asylum
2. The originals not copies should be attached as exhibits to said return
3. The answers to the questions answered by the physicians are contradictory of
such other + show that the said Balch was should have been confered
4. The return ought, but does not, show facts to justify the constution of the detention of said Balch
In the matter of the restraint of James A. Balch
